title: Data Visualization 1
text:
This dataset contains information on artists, including their names, genders, birth years, and places of origin. Here, I created a visualization the top 5 artist birth years to find the years that produced the most artists. The bar chart at the bottom displays the five most common years of birth in the dataset.


library(tidyverse)

artists <- read_csv("artists.csv")

top_birth_years <- artists |>
  filter(!is.na(yearOfBirth)) |>
  group_by(yearOfBirth) |>
  summarize(n = n()) |>
  arrange(desc(n)) |>
  head(5)

top_birth_years

# A tibble: 5 × 2
  yearOfBirth     n
        <dbl> <int>
1        1936    49
2        1930    48
3        1928    45
4        1967    45
5        1938    41



ggplot(top_birth_years, aes(x = reorder(as.factor(yearOfBirth), n), y = n)) +
  geom_col(fill = "steelBlue") +
  labs(
    title = "Top 5 Years of Artist Births",
    x = "Year of Birth",
    y = "Number of Artists"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()








The TidyTuesday data can be found at: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2021/2021-01-12/artists.csv
This data comes from the Tate Art Museum (original GitHub link): https://github.com/tategallery/collection

title: Data Visualization 2
text:
This analysis uses the TidyTuesday chocolate ratings dataset which contains reviews many different chocolate bars. I focus on the countries of cocoa bean origin to see which regions appear most often in the data. The plot below shows the ten most common bean origins.

library(tidyverse)

chocolate <- read_csv("chocolate.csv")

top_bean_countries <- chocolate |>
  filter(!is.na(country_of_bean_origin)) |>
  count(country_of_bean_origin, sort = TRUE) |>
  head(10)

top_bean_countries

# A tibble: 10 × 2
   country_of_bean_origin     n
   <chr>                  <int>
 1 Venezuela                253
 2 Peru                     244
 3 Dominican Republic       226
 4 Ecuador                  219
 5 Madagascar               177
 6 Blend                    156
 7 Nicaragua                100
 8 Bolivia                   80
 9 Colombia                  79
10 Tanzania                  79



ggplot(top_bean_countries, aes(x = reorder(country_of_bean_origin, n), y = n)) +
  geom_col(fill = "chocolate4") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "Top 10 Countries of Cocoa Bean Origin",
    x = "Country of Bean Origin",
    y = "Number of Reviews"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()








The TidyTuesday data can be found at: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2022/2022-01-18/chocolate.csv
This data comes from Flavors of Cacao by way of Georgios and Kelsey. (original link): https://flavorsofcacao.com/chocolate_database.html

title: William Walz
text: Hi, this is for my Data Science class! I’ve made two visualizations of random TidyTuesday datasets.
